entry.title: Art supply tote box
entry.summary: A box for storing/carrying art supplies (paint tubes) modeled on a Japanese style toolbox. Similar box by John Zhu here https://youtu.be/pxa88seXsNc?si=2QYJmRWRqUD6E20g&t=567 I made this from reclaimed timber from a chest of drawers.  The wood is quite soft, but nice and light which is important so the…
entry.content:
A box for storing/carrying art supplies (paint tubes) modeled on a Japanese style toolbox.

Similar box by John Zhu here https://youtu.be/pxa88seXsNc?si=2QYJmRWRqUD6E20g&t=567

I made this from reclaimed timber from a chest of drawers.  The wood is quite soft, but nice and light which is important so the box isn't too heavy.

Preliminary design

Larger box on the bottom, with a handle.  A slightly smaller box sits on top of this as a lid.  There is also a small till in the bottom box for paint brushes etc.

Cutting and assembling the boxes

Glued up and ready to finish

Finished with boiled linseed oil and shellac

entry.title: Small hexagonal box
entry.summary: Made using offcuts/remaining boards from the previous striped box. This was pretty rough as it was mostly an experiment in cutting dovetails for a non-rectangular box.

entry.title: Striped box
entry.summary: Slats from an outdoor dining table, jointed into boards for a box with contrasting light-coloured wood strips. Attempt to photograph on a plain background Unfortunately, I didn't pay quite enough attention to detail, as the jointed boards had subtly different widths meaning that the light…
entry.content:
Slats from an outdoor dining table, jointed into boards for a box with contrasting light-coloured wood strips.

Attempt to photograph on a plain background

Unfortunately, I didn't pay quite enough attention to detail, as the jointed boards had subtly different widths meaning that the light strips don't meet up exactly on one corner.

Also, the top strip is a different colour wood than the bottom one, but that isn't clear and it just looks like it's dirty.

entry.title: Tilting-framed-lid box
entry.summary: A small box with a complicated lid.  Framed to avoid having to glue up a larger piece and avoid end-grain.  Lid slides and tilts to open. Closed Open Open Fully open
entry.content: A small box with a complicated lid.  Framed to avoid having to glue up a larger piece and avoid end-grain.  Lid slides and tilts to open.

entry.title: Kitchen projects
entry.summary: A paper-towel roll holder.  The base pieces are interlocked bridle joints, which is a dumb idea but I didn't want to make it not-symmetrical... Pantry insert shelf for easier storage of small loose items (biscuit packets etc.)
entry.content:
A paper-towel roll holder.  The base pieces are interlocked bridle joints, which is a dumb idea but I didn't want to make it not-symmetrical...

entry.title: Framed Crate
entry.summary: This crate ended up looking a little fancy, but it was made from an unknown wood from the inside (frame and drawer rails) of a chest of drawers.  And pine from a bed end. It is roughly the size of a milk-crate (300mm). Adding the…
entry.content:
This crate ended up looking a little fancy, but it was made from an unknown wood from the inside (frame and drawer rails) of a chest of drawers.  And pine from a bed end. It is roughly the size of a milk-crate (300mm).

Adding the lapped dovetails on the base supports was a bit of a mistake, as this made assembling and disassembling more complicated.  It will add strength to stop the bottom splaying though...

Glued together in stages.  Added glue to just some inner joints on the sides, and then assembled so that they dried in the correct positions. Then disassembled and glued the next set of joints and repeated.  This was very fiddly but meant the glue-up wasn't too rushed and everything mostly fitted all the way through.

This also meant that the side frame (H pieces) could be planed/sanded flush before inserting into the outer frame, which would have got in the way as the sides are inset from the main cube.

The final result has a nice contrast of wood colours and grain directions.

entry.title: Framed box
entry.summary: This box took a long time to complete as I was only spending little snippets of time on it. The goal was to make as much box as possible out of two scrappy boards. One was resawn and used for the panels, the other was…
entry.content:
This box took a long time to complete as I was only spending little snippets of time on it.

The goal was to make as much box as possible out of two scrappy boards. One was resawn and used for the panels, the other was ripped and grooved for the frame.

The lid and base panels were joined from two pieces.

The original rough calculations where accompanied by a detour through a python program to calculate the maximum dimensions possible.

Many mistakes were made but it ended up looking ok.
